channel.title: [PI] Compiling Question
channel.description:
When I compile I get a lot of errors. I can still run the server fine though but I'm not sure if its effecting it. I am on a mac so I'm compiling from the terminal. I have not made any changes to the server. I'm just now starting to use it and it comes up with these errors. I'm sure it has something to do with compiling from the terminal..
[code]Connection.java:9: package server.model.players does not exist import server.model.players.Client; ^ Connection.java:310: cannot find symbol symbol : class Client location: class server.Connection public static boolean isMuted(Client c) { ^ Server.java:7: package org.apache.mina.common does not exist import org.apache.mina.common.IoAcceptor; ^ Server.java:8: package org.apache.mina.transport.socket.nio does not exist import org.apache.mina.transport.socket.nio.SocketAcceptor; ^ Server.java:9: package org.apache.mina.transport.socket.nio does not exist import org.apache.mina.transport.socket.nio.SocketAcceptorConfig; ^ Server.java:11: package server.event does not exist import server.event.EventManager; ^ Server.java:12: package server.model.npcs does not exist import server.model.npcs.NPCHandler; ^ Server.java:13: package server.model.npcs does not exist import server.model.npcs.NPCDrops; ^ Server.java:14: package server.model.players does not exist import server.model.players.PlayerHandler; ^ Server.java:15: package server.model.players does not exist import server.model.players.Player; ^ Server.java:16: package server.model.players does not exist import server.model.players.Client; ^ Server.java:17: package server.model.players does not exist import server.model.players.PlayerSave; ^ Server.java:18: package server.model.minigames does not exist import server.model.minigames.*; ^ Server.java:19: package server.net does not exist import server.net.ConnectionHandler; ^ Server.java:20: package server.net does not exist import server.net.ConnectionThrottleFilter; ^ Server.java:21: package server.util does not exist import server.util.ShutDownHook; ^ Server.java:22: package server.util does not exist import server.util.SimpleTimer; ^ Server.java:23: package server.util.log does not exist import server.util.log.Logger; ^ Server.java:24: package server.world does not exist import server.world.ItemHandler; ^ Server.java:25: package server.world does not exist import server.world.ObjectHandler; ^ Server.java:26: package server.world does not exist import server.world.ObjectManager; ^ Server.java:27: package server.world does not exist import server.world.ShopHandler; ^ Server.java:28: package server.world.map does not exist import server.world.map.VirtualWorld; ^ Server.java:29: package server.world does not exist import server.world.ClanChatHandler; ^ Server.java:30: package server.world does not exist import server.world.WorldMap; ^ Server.java:49: cannot find symbol symbol : class IoAcceptor location: class server.Server private static IoAcceptor acceptor; ^ Server.java:50: cannot find symbol symbol : class ConnectionHandler location: class server.Server private static ConnectionHandler connectionHandler; ^ Server.java:51: cannot find symbol symbol : class ConnectionThrottleFilter location: class server.Server private static ConnectionThrottleFilter throttleFilter; ^ Server.java:52: cannot find symbol symbol : class SimpleTimer location: class server.Server private static SimpleTimer engineTimer, debugTimer; ^ Server.java:58: cannot find symbol symbol : class ItemHandler location: class server.Server public static ItemHandler itemHandler = new ItemHandler(); ^ Server.java:59: cannot find symbol symbol : class PlayerHandler location: class server.Server public static PlayerHandler playerHandler = new PlayerHandler(); ^ Server.java:60: cannot find symbol symbol : class NPCHandler location: class server.Server public static NPCHandler npcHandler = new NPCHandler(); ^ Server.java:61: cannot find symbol symbol : class ShopHandler location: class server.Server public static ShopHandler shopHandler = new ShopHandler(); ^ Server.java:62: cannot find symbol symbol : class ObjectHandler location: class server.Server public static ObjectHandler objectHandler = new ObjectHandler(); ^ Server.java:63: cannot find symbol symbol : class ObjectManager location: class server.Server public static ObjectManager objectManager = new ObjectManager(); ^ Server.java:64: cannot find symbol symbol : class CastleWars location: class server.Server public static CastleWars castleWars = new CastleWars(); ^ Server.java:65: cannot find symbol symbol : class FightPits location: class server.Server public static FightPits fightPits = new FightPits(); ^ Server.java:66: cannot find symbol symbol : class PestControl location: class server.Server public static PestControl pestControl = new PestControl(); ^ Server.java:67: cannot find symbol symbol : class NPCDrops location: class server.Server public static NPCDrops npcDrops = new NPCDrops(); ^ Server.java:68: cannot find symbol symbol : class ClanChatHandler location: class server.Server public static ClanChatHandler clanChat = new ClanChatHandler(); ^ Server.java:69: cannot find symbol symbol : class FightCaves location: class server.Server public static FightCaves fightCaves = new FightCaves(); ^ Server.java:58: cannot find symbol symbol : class ItemHandler location: class server.Server public static ItemHandler itemHandler = new ItemHandler(); ^ Server.java:59: cannot find symbol symbol : class PlayerHandler location: class server.Server public static PlayerHandler playerHandler = new PlayerHandler(); ^ Server.java:60: cannot find symbol symbol : class NPCHandler location: class server.Server public static NPCHandler npcHandler = new NPCHandler(); ^ Server.java:61: cannot find symbol symbol : class ShopHandler location: class server.Server public static ShopHandler shopHandler = new ShopHandler(); ^ Server.java:62: cannot find symbol symbol : class ObjectHandler location: class server.Server public static ObjectHandler objectHandler = new ObjectHandler(); ^ Server.java:63: cannot find symbol symbol : class ObjectManager location: class server.Server public static ObjectManager objectManager = new ObjectManager(); ^ Server.java:64: cannot find symbol symbol : class CastleWars location: class server.Server public static CastleWars castleWars = new CastleWars(); ^ Server.java:65: cannot find symbol symbol : class FightPits location: class server.Server public static FightPits fightPits = new FightPits(); ^ Server.java:66: cannot find symbol symbol : class PestControl location: class server.Server public static PestControl pestControl = new PestControl(); ^ Server.java:67: cannot find symbol symbol : class NPCDrops location: class server.Server public static NPCDrops npcDrops = new NPCDrops(); ^ Server.java:68: cannot find symbol symbol : class ClanChatHandler location: class server.Server public static ClanChatHandler clanChat = new ClanChatHandler(); ^ Server.java:69: cannot find symbol symbol : class FightCaves location: class server.Server public static FightCaves fightCaves = new FightCaves(); ^ Server.java:81: cannot find symbol symbol : class SimpleTimer location: class server.Server engineTimer = new SimpleTimer(); ^ Server.java:82: cannot find symbol symbol : class SimpleTimer location: class server.Server debugTimer = new SimpleTimer(); ^ Server.java:96: cannot find symbol symbol : class Logger location: class server.Server System.setOut(new Logger(System.out)); ^ Server.java:97: cannot find symbol symbol : class Logger location: class server.Server System.setErr(new Logger(System.err)); ^ Server.java:115: cannot find symbol symbol : class SocketAcceptor location: class server.Server acceptor = new SocketAcceptor(); ^ Server.java:116: cannot find symbol symbol : class ConnectionHandler location: class server.Server connectionHandler = new ConnectionHandler(); ^ Server.java:118: cannot find symbol symbol : class SocketAcceptorConfig location: class server.Server SocketAcceptorConfig sac = new SocketAcceptorConfig(); ^ Server.java:118: cannot find symbol symbol : class SocketAcceptorConfig location: class server.Server SocketAcceptorConfig sac = new SocketAcceptorConfig(); ^ Server.java:123: cannot find symbol symbol : class ConnectionThrottleFilter location: class server.Server throttleFilter = new ConnectionThrottleFilter(Config.CONNECTION_DELAY); ^ Server.java:130: cannot find symbol symbol : variable EventManager location: class server.Server EventManager.initialize(); ^ Server.java:162: cannot find symbol symbol : class Player location: class server.Server for(Player p : PlayerHandler.players) { ^ Server.java:162: cannot find symbol symbol : variable PlayerHandler location: class server.Server for(Player p : PlayerHandler.players) { ^ Server.java:165: cannot find symbol symbol : class Client location: class server.Server PlayerSave.saveGame((Client)p); ^ Server.java:165: cannot find symbol symbol : variable PlayerSave location: class server.Server PlayerSave.saveGame((Client)p); ^ Server.java:175: cannot find symbol symbol : class Player location: class server.Server for(Player p : PlayerHandler.players) { ^ Server.java:175: cannot find symbol symbol : variable PlayerHandler location: class server.Server for(Player p : PlayerHandler.players) { ^ Server.java:178: cannot find symbol symbol : class Client location: class server.Server PlayerSave.saveGame((Client)p); ^ Server.java:178: cannot find symbol symbol : variable PlayerSave location: class server.Server PlayerSave.saveGame((Client)p); ^ Server.java:202: cannot find symbol symbol : variable PlayerHandler location: class server.Server System.out.println("Players online: " + PlayerHandler.playerCount+ ", engine load: "+ debugPercentFormat.format(engineLoad)); ^ 72 errors [/code]

item.title: [PI] Compiling Question
item.dc:creator: @Gnartox Gnartox
item.description:
@Gnartox wrote:

Ok, try putting a colon after each java, and make it all one big statement. (Not positive this will work)

Similar response?

javac: invalid flag: srcservermodelitems*.java: Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options

And if you put the .java files in one folder, it wont work at all because of how the includes work/ how it is packaged.

Ahh I see…

EDIT: I figured it out. All the \ needed to be changed to / because the back slash makes a space in the text on macs.

Thanks for the help Daginith.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Compiling Question
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote=“Gnartox, post:9, topic:434835”]Do you think there is way to make just one folder to put all the .java files in?

Here’s what I got this time.

javac: file not found: srcservermodelitems*.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options

Run.sh should look like this right?

By the way. Thanks for all the help so far I really appreciate it man.[/quote]
Ok, try putting a colon after each java, and make it all one big statement. (Not positive this will work)

And if you put the .java files in one folder, it wont work at all because of how the includes work/ how it is packaged.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Gnartox Gnartox
item.description:
@Gnartox wrote:

Do you think there is way to make just one folder to put all the .java files in?

Here’s what I got this time.

javac: file not found: srcservermodelitems*.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options

Run.sh should look like this right?

By the way. Thanks for all the help so far I really appreciate it man.

item.title: [PI] Compiling Question
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote=“Gnartox, post:7, topic:434835”]I got this…

javac: invalid flag: deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar:deps/jython.jar:deps/xstream.jar:deps/mina.jar:deps/mysql.jar:deps/poi.jar:deps/slf4j.jar:deps/slf4j-nop.jar Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options

Sorry if this is an easy fix I really don’t know what to do.

I was taught to change directory to where the .java files are and than just enter javac *.java[/quote]

try adding a -classpath after the ‘java’ i deleted that by accident

and if you do *.java it wont compile all the .java files, just the ones in that directory.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Compiling Question
item.dc:creator: @Gnartox Gnartox
item.description:
@Gnartox wrote:

I got this…

javac: invalid flag: deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar:deps/jython.jar:deps/xstream.jar:deps/mina.jar:deps/mysql.jar:deps/poi.jar:deps/slf4j.jar:deps/slf4j-nop.jar Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options

Sorry if this is an easy fix I really don’t know what to do.

I was taught to change directory to where the .java files are and than just enter javac *.java

item.title: [PI] Compiling Question
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote=“Gnartox, post:5, topic:434835”]Okay here is my compile.bat

@echo off COLOR C ECHO Compiling - Project Insanity ECHO Please wait patiently... TITLE Compile - Server javac -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event\*.java src\server\model\items\*.java src\server\model\minigames\*.java src\server\model\npcs\*.java src\server\model\objects\*.java src\server\model\players\*.java src\server\model\players\skills\*.java src\server\model\players\packets\*.java src\server\model\shops\*.java src\server\net\*.java src\server\task\*.java src\server\util\*.java src\server\world\*.java src\server\util\log\*.java src\server\*.java src\server\world\map\*.java pause

If I post this in the terminal it doesn’t compile at all. I do replace the semi colons with colons.[/quote]

Try this. it should work. Make it a run.sh in the same dir as the .bat files.

javac deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar:deps/jython.jar:deps/xstream.jar:deps/mina.jar:deps/mysql.jar:deps/poi.jar:deps/slf4j.jar:deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d src\server\event\*.java src\server\model\items\*.java src\server\model\minigames\*.java src\server\model\npcs\*.java src\server\model\objects\*.java src\server\model\players\*.java src\server\model\players\skills\*.java src\server\model\players\packets\*.java src\server\model\shops\*.java src\server\net\*.java src\server\task\*.java src\server\util\*.java src\server\world\*.java src\server\util\log\*.java src\server\*.java src\server\world\map\*.java

Read full topic

@Gnartox wrote:

Okay here is my compile.bat

@echo off COLOR C ECHO Compiling - Project Insanity ECHO Please wait patiently... TITLE Compile - Server javac -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event\*.java src\server\model\items\*.java src\server\model\minigames\*.java src\server\model\npcs\*.java src\server\model\objects\*.java src\server\model\players\*.java src\server\model\players\skills\*.java src\server\model\players\packets\*.java src\server\model\shops\*.java src\server\net\*.java src\server\task\*.java src\server\util\*.java src\server\world\*.java src\server\util\log\*.java src\server\*.java src\server\world\map\*.java pause

If I post this in the terminal it doesn’t compile at all. I do replace the semi colons with colons.

item.title: [PI] Compiling Question
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote=“Gnartox, post:3, topic:434835”][quote author=Daginith link=topic=537552.msg3930734#msg3930734 date=1330650638]
Your most likely not including the .jar files when you compile it.

Post your run.bat (or run.sh) here. I use Linux, so I should be able to help you.
[/quote]

I put this in the terminal.

cd /Users/Gnartox/Desktop/Gnartox/GnarScape\ Client\ \&\ Server/GnarScape\ Server/src/server javac *.java

Then all of the errors pop up.

Maybe I’m not including all of the folders that contain .java?

So would I have to keep changing the directory until all the .javas are compiled? That’s going to take a while if so. Is there a way I can just move all the .java files into one place so I only have to change directory once?[/quote]
that looks a little messy, post the one that came with the server here

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Compiling Question
item.dc:creator: @Gnartox Gnartox
item.description:
@Gnartox wrote:

[quote=“Daginith, post:2, topic:434835”]Your most likely not including the .jar files when you compile it.

Post your run.bat (or run.sh) here. I use Linux, so I should be able to help you.[/quote]

I put this in the terminal.

cd /Users/Gnartox/Desktop/Gnartox/GnarScape\ Client\ \&\ Server/GnarScape\ Server/src/server javac *.java

Then all of the errors pop up.

Maybe I’m not including all of the folders that contain .java?

So would I have to keep changing the directory until all the .javas are compiled? That’s going to take a while if so. Is there a way I can just move all the .java files into one place so I only have to change directory once?

Post your run.bat (or run.sh) here. I use Linux, so I should be able to help you.

When I compile I get a lot of errors. I can still run the server fine though but I’m not sure if its effecting it. I am on a mac so I’m compiling from the terminal. I have not made any changes to the server. I’m just now starting to use it and it comes up with these errors. I’m sure it has something to do with compiling from the terminal…
